010package imagingbook.common.image.interpolation;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import imagingbook.common.image.access.ScalarAccessor;
015
016/**
017 * <p>
018 * A {@link PixelInterpolator} implementing Lanczos interpolation in 2D.
019 * See Sec. 22.5.4 of [1] for additional details.
020 * </p>
021 * <p>
022 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 
023 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
024 * </p>
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 *
028 */
029public class LanczosInterpolator implements PixelInterpolator {
030        
031        private final int n;    // order (tap count) of this interpolator
032        private final int d;    // kernel width
033        
034        /**
035         * Constructor creating a Lanczos interpolator of order n = 2.
036         */
037        public LanczosInterpolator() {
038                this(2);
039        }
040        
041        /**
042         * Constructor creating a Lanczos interpolator of arbitrary order n &ge; 2.
043         * @param n order of the interpolator
044         */
045        public LanczosInterpolator(int n) {
046                if (n < 2) {
047                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Lanczos order must be >= 2");
048                }
049                this.n = n; // order >= 2
050                this.d = 2 * n - 1;
051        }
052        
053        @Override
054        public float getInterpolatedValue(ScalarAccessor ia, double x, double y) {
055                final int u0 = (int) Math.floor(x); // use floor to handle negative coordinates too
056                final int v0 = (int) Math.floor(y);
057                double q = 0;
058                for (int j = 0; j <= d; j++) {
059                        int v = v0 + j - n + 1;
060                        double p = 0;
061                        for (int i = 0; i <= d; i++) {
062                                int u = u0 + i - n + 1;
063                                p = p + wLn(x - u) * ia.getVal(u, v);
064                        }
065                        q = q + wLn(y - v) * p;
066                }
067                return (float) q;
068        }
069        
070        
071        private static final double pi = Math.PI;
072        private static final double pi2 = sqr(pi);
073        
074        private double wLn(double x) { // 1D Lanczos interpolator of order n
075                final double r = Math.abs(x);
076                if (r < 0.001) 
077                        return 1.0;
078                if (r < n) {
079                        return n * (Math.sin(pi * r / n) * Math.sin(pi * r)) / (pi2 * sqr(r));
080                }
081                else 
082                        return 0.0;
083        }
084
085        @Override
086        public double getWeight(double x) {
087                return wLn(x);
088        }
089
090
091}
